file_content.text: Bowdaar honors you as a great friend.
That was a great fight!
Thanks for the assist, Bowdaar.
It sure was, big guy.
Bowdaar owed you for the Kaleesh.
Remind me to tell you about that time on Ord Mantell.
I've had better.
Bowdaar wants to hear your fight stories.
You just stood around looking hairy.
Don't act like you helped.
I did my share of fighting!
Wookiee! I have delicious leftover food for you. Go to your cage and feast!
The Hutt poisons me again. Goodbye.
Bowdaar waits for a new fight.
Whoa, Captain. Don't get so close. Thing's liable to tear your arms off and beat you to death with them.
There's nothing to be afraid of.
You're overreacting.
Tell that to the reptiles littering the floor.
He's welcome to try.
Didn't know you had a death wish.
Shut up.
Go right ahead and get yourself killed, then.
That was a good fight. Bowdaar honors you.
What's your story, Bowdaar?
Tell me about yourself.
I fight to pay debts. The Hutt chooses my enemies until the debt is paid.
You okay?
I fought bone-lizards before. Their smell is worse than their bite.
Don't you eat your kills, hairball?
You miserable beast.
I'm no savage!
Wookiee! Get back to your cage. I'll call you again when I want you.
I'm going now. Goodbye.
The Hutt sends me things to fight.
You want something?
How'd you wind up fighting for this Hutt?
Why are you here?
My master owes the Hutt. I fight to pay his debt.
Sorry I let you fight the Kaleesh alone.
I should've helped you.
I don't blame you. It wasn't your fight.
You sure know your way around a fight, Wookiee.
You're pretty tough.
If I am weak, I die.
I'm going now. Goodbye, friend.
Bowdaar honors your fighting skill.
Right back at you, Bowdaar.
And I honor yours.
Next time, let Bowdaar join you.
Nobody crosses me and lives.
I never back down.
That is the warrior's way.
I don't need your "honors," shag.
Save it, you hairy scum.
Don't call me that!
You fought well against the metal man.
When you spend your whole life fighting, winning comes naturally.
It was nothing.
Bowdaar would enjoy fighting at your side.
I'm a warrior like you.
We have a lot in common.
You're not like me. You're free.
Why didn't you step in? I hate fair fights.
You could've helped.
That was not my battle.
